articles.title: Wetzel: The NFL's Bill Belichick skepticism is being validated in Chapel Hill
articles.summary: An NFC personnel director told ESPN that Belichick comes up "within the first five minutes" of every conversation.

articles.title: Cowboys' Diggs out Sunday after home accident
articles.summary: The Cowboys will be without cornerback Trevon Diggs on Sunday against the Commanders after an accident at his home Thursday put him in the concussion protocol.

articles.title: Rams rule star WR Nacua (ankle) out vs. Jags
articles.summary: The Rams have ruled leading receiver Puka Nacua out for Sunday's matchup against the Jaguars in London, coach Sean McVay announced Friday.

articles.title: Commanders WR McLaurin out 4th straight game
articles.summary: Commanders receiver Terry McLaurin will miss his fourth consecutive game with a right quad injury, coach Dan Quinn said Friday.

articles.title: Fins' McDaniel shuts down 'baseless' trade rumors
articles.summary: Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel shut down "baseless" trade rumors Friday, saying the team is not currently looking to trade any players.

articles.title: Flacco savors Bengals' victory after uncertainty
articles.summary: Following his benching in Cleveland and his trade to Cincinnati, Joe Flacco said the opportunity to lead the Bengals to a comeback win was "pretty special."

articles.title: Steelers blame 'unacceptable' run defense for loss
articles.summary: After Thursday night's loss, numerous Steelers defensive players said the root of the problem was their inability to stop the league's worst rushing attack, as the Bengals put up a season-high 142 yards, nearly more than double their previous best.

articles.title: Rodgers passes Big Ben in yards, now 5th all time
articles.summary: Aaron Rodgers overtook former Steelers great Ben Roethlisberger for fifth on the NFL's all-time passing yards list during Thursday night's loss to the Bengals.
